In true unschooling fashion. :o) Learning comes in all shapes and sizes and
from many different sources, not just reading. It all counts. From what I've
seen, your lovely wife is a pretty knowledgable source.

Welcome Thomas. Glad you're here.

~Mary

messages.subject: Hello - (wow this is the largest list I have ever been on)
messages.msgSnippet: Just wanted to say hello to everyone before I slip into obscurity. My name is Thomas Kuykendall, husband to Nanci K.  I am trying to keep up on the home
messages.messageBody:
Just wanted to say hello to everyone before I slip into obscurity.
My name is Thomas Kuykendall, husband to Nanci K. I am trying to
keep up on the home schooling subject and have done a pretty poor job
of it to date. Most of my knowledge is from my lovely wife and I
really do try my best to educate my children, especially when they
ask those all important question starting with, "Daddy, why is..."

Due to my limited time to read email (usually done on breaks at work)
and even more limited time to answer any, I will pretty much be a
lurker. No, I don't have long hair (yuck, too much effort to take
care of) or a beard, I sure hope that doesn't mean I will have to
leave.

Oh yeh, if I do reply and my message makes absolutely no sense, Nanci
will definitely be discussing it with me and follow up with a much
better explanation of what I really ment to say. What can I say. I
am in Engineer and english was a second language for me.

T4of5

ps.

For those woundering, I am the 4th Thomas in 5 consecutive
generations of Thomas'. I have gone with the BORG theme and go by
the T4of5 designation. Remember, RESISTANCE IS FUTILE.
